mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on \\smb2.aber.ac.uk\advisory,
you need to install smbfs to get that to work
but, smb has a 2gig filesize limit.  you're better off using "cifs" instead of "smbfs"
what if you use "-t cifs" instead?
I use this: mount -t cifs -o password=,uid=chris //server/dokumenty ~/smb/server/dokumenty
do you use a proxy server?
that's why then.  synaptics knows about the proxy, and apt-get doesn't
